communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Jason Andre Wilson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All available dash camera and body camera footage related to a high speed chase and subsequent shooting incident on November 13, 2024 involving Jason Andre Wilson, 23 and a Coweta County Sheriff K9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

QS Investigations

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Settlements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all reports, lists, databases, or individual documents created since 1/1/16 detail lawsuits brought against the city's police department. This should include any documentation mechanism your department uses to track lawsuits. It should also include any documents your department submits to local, state, or federal agencies listing the number and/or status of lawsuits brought against the police department.

This request should include documents compiled quarterly, annually, or in other increments and documents or databases that contain responsive information over a longer time span.

Please provide all available materials from January 1, 2016 through November 6, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Please export them as .csv

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: MKUltra Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents relating to the MKULTRA, BLUEBIRD/ARTICHOKE projects as undertaken by the CIA primarily between 1951 and 1973. These have already been identified, as listed recently in a Requester Report in response to FOIA request, reference: F-2023-01896 (requested by John Heywood on 27th August 2023).

The document is available here: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/mkultra-151276/#file-1145109

In your response to Mr Heywood, attaching the requester report, you mention that a DVD has been compiled with the documents listed in the report. Please could I request a copy of that DVD.

If that is not possible, I would like to order copies of the following documents from the Requester Report: 

Mori ID: 20476 - 01/01/1978 - MKULTRA - INSTITUTIONAL NOTIFICATIONS; MKULTRA ADDITIONAL INSTITUTIONS NOTIFIED; MKSEARCH INSTITUTIONAL NOTIFICATIONS; BLUEBIRD ARTICHOKE INSTITUTIONAL NOTIFICATIONS; OTHER PROJECTS

Mori ID: 442307 - 01/01/1900 - (EST PUB DATE) NON-GOVERNMENT RESEARCHERS, WORK LOCATIONS AND/OR INSTITUTIONAL AFFILIATIONS MENTIONED IN SUMMARIES OF RECENTLY RECOVERED MKULTRA SUBPROJECTS 

I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am a journalist and producer for a podcast production company and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

Blanchard House (https://www.blanchard-house.com/about) is recognized for producing narrative podcast documentary series, reporting and publishing regular series on issues of public interest and importance, such as the below examples:

Black And Blue - blanchard-house.com/releases/blackandblue
Pirate of Prague - https://www.blanchard-house.com/releases/nwfei4clq9mes1v8n3hacvrt3tkpi0

In addition, I have worked as a public service journalist during my career, and plan to use my editorial skills (honed as a producer for the BBC for nearly 20 years) to analyze and produce original reporting work for our podcast audience, who listen to our programmes on platforms including Wondery, Apple podcasts or Audible. 

Examples of some of my previous journalistic work are here:
BBC Radio 4 - Putin’s Religious War - https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m00162mp
BBC Radio 4 - The Unabomber - https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07654x0

If you have any questions about my media status, please contact me.


In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 
If the DVD is not available I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Maxted

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports state that departments in you state have partnered with Massive Blue, an AI company (discussed at recent county council meeting). 

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of Massive Blue, "Overwatch," VIPS (Virtual Investigator Protection Service), RADAR: (Realtime active data aggregation reporter), and/or ITFM System (Investigative Task Force multiplier). This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of Massive Blue/Overwatch, B) any explanations (whether internally or externally generated) of how Massive Blue/Overwatch works, and C) any other document that has been used to help explain the use of Massive Blue/Overwatch, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) A copy of any privacy impact assessments, use policies, technical explainers or assessments, standard operating procedures, data retention policies, legal opinions or assessments, warranties, non-disclosure agreements, contracts, liability waivers, insurance agreements, Requests for Proposals, Responses to Requests for Proposal, Memorandums of Understanding, Letters of Interest, usage policies, or informal agreements between the police department/this office and Massive Blue.

3) A copy of any funding opportunity announcements, grant applications and grantor status/progress reports, reports to legislative bodies, annual reports that mention Massive Blue/Overwatch, as well as audit records, including but not limited to security audits of the software, misuse reports, and reports to oversight bodies.

4) Any digital communications including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) that mention Massive Blue or sent to/from email addresses with the @massiveblue.ai domain.

5) Any case reports in which Overwatch/Massive Blue was used.

6) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) with Massive Blue representatives.

7) Any digital communications / presentations / contracts (including but not limited to emails and text messages) with employees of the Arizona Department of Public Safety about this project.

Please try to include any other miscellaneous documents that facilitate this department's relationship with Massive Blue or overwatch that don't neatly fall neatly into the above categories. Please search between January 1, 2023 and the time this request is published.

The requested documents will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent technology journalism website: www.404media.co

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

Alexandra Gelzin

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All emails and communications (including attachments) sent or received by agency personnel between October 15, 2024, and the present date that:

- Involve representatives of Magnet Forensics or GrayKey or Cellebrite.

- Include any email correspondence with email addresses ending in @magnetforensics.com or @cellebrite.com.

- OR otherwise Mention or reference the forensic access tool GrayKey or Cellebrite in any capacity.

For purposes of this request, the term "emails and communications" should include, but not be limited to, emails, email attachments, text messages, instant messaging chat logs, or any other form of written correspondence.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra
